info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 1:34PM EDT until June 2 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Miami Gardens, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Opa-Locka, Miami Shores, Golden Glades, Hard Rock Stadium, Westview, Pinewood, West Little River, Ojus, Biscayne Park, Saint Thomas University and Ives Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
